title: Analyzing f from graph of f' part - a

content.description: Let f be the function defined for x ≥ 0 with f(0)=5 and f', the first derivative of f, given by f'(x)= e(-x/4)}sin(x2). The graph of y = f'(x) is shown above.
content.question:
Use the graph of f' to determine whether the graph of f is
concave up, concave down, or neither on the interval 1.7<x<1.9. Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text:
Use the graph of f' to determine whether the graph of f is
concave up, concave down, or neither on the interval 1.7<x<1.9. Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
